doc: It is not possible to use the HttpAdapter with electron, vue and webpack

First of all, sorry for bad English.

I am building a desktop application that uses electron and vuejs. I need to communicate with some third-party APIs. As I'm using webpack to compile my vue code for both production and test environment, XHRAdapter is always selected, this is the default behavior. But how can I select the HttpAdapter in this environment? Although the axios have been designed for both the browser and the node, in hybrid environments like the one I'm working on it does not seem to be flexible.

I know this replacement by XHRAdapter is expected. But how can I say this using electron? I've seen other issues like this one, but none have come up with a definitive solution. I've researched a lot and tried a few different approaches but it did not work for me. I would like to continue using Axios as my standard communication tool, in previous versions I used the [Request](http://github.com/request/request) but it does not seem to be as fast as Axios.
